items.title: L&T shares in focus after strategic tie-up with BEL for 5th-gen fighter jet programme
items.description: Larsen & Toubro (L&T) and Bharat Electronics Ltd (BEL) have announced a strategic partnership to support the Indian Air Force’s Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) programme, a key element of India’s 5th-generation fighter jet initiative. The consortium will leverage L&T’s aerospace expertise and BEL’s defence electronics capabilities, advancing indigenous defence under the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ initiative.

items.title: Polycab India shares in focus as promoters likely set to offload Rs 887 crore equity via block deals
items.description: Polycab share price: Polycab India promoters plan to sell up to 0.81% stake via block deals worth around Rs 887 crore, with a floor price of Rs 7,300 per share. Multiple promoter group members, including Inder and Ajay Jaisinghani, are participating in the stake sale.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Zydus Lifesciences, Shree Cement among 5 stocks that could give 12-36% return
items.description: Brokerages remain optimistic on select stocks across pharma, cement, banking, consumer, and chemicals.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Waaree Energies shares in focus on Rs 300 crore investment in subsidiary for battery cell plant
items.description: Waaree Energies share price: Waaree Energies has announced a Rs 300 crore investment in its wholly-owned subsidiary, Waaree Energy Storage Solutions Private Limited, to set up a 3.5 GWh lithium-ion battery cell plant. The infusion, via a rights issue, aims to boost the company’s renewable energy and energy storage capabilities.

items.title: Nazara Technologies shares approach record date for 1:1 bonus issue, 1:2 stock split. What it means for investors?
items.description: Nazara Technologies investors, take note. September 25 is the last day to buy shares for the bonus issue and stock split. Shares will trade ex-bonus and ex-split from September 26. The company announced a 1:1 bonus and a 1:2 stock split. This aims to improve liquidity and affordability. Investors will see their share count increase.

items.title: Stock split, bonus issue alert! Last day to buy shares of these 6 cos to qualify for eligibility
items.description: Investors, take note. Today is the final day to buy shares of companies like MOS Utility. This is to be eligible for upcoming stock splits and bonus issues. PVV Infra and RM Drip are splitting their stocks. Chandra Prabhu International and KKV Agro Powers are among those issuing bonus shares. Ensure shares are in your demat account by today's end.

items.title: JD Cables IPO shares to list today; decent GMP keeps investors interested
items.description: JD Cables, a Howrah-based manufacturer, will launch on the BSE SME platform. The IPO saw strong investor interest, subscribing 127.8 times. The IPO price was finalized at Rs 152 per share. Grey market activity indicates a premium. Retail investors, QIBs, and NIIs showed significant demand. The company will use IPO proceeds for working capital and debt repayment.

items.title: Ivalue Infosolutions IPO listing today. GMP suggests cautious buzz
items.description: Bengaluru's Ivalue Infosolutions is set to launch on the market. Its Rs 560 crore IPO closed recently. The IPO was subscribed 1.82 times. Anchor investors invested Rs 168 crore. The company specializes in digital transformation. It operates in multiple countries. Revenue for FY25 reached Rs 942 crore. Net profit rose to Rs 85.3 crore.

items.title: Netweb Tech, Samvardhana Motherson among 6 stocks close crossing below VWAP
items.description: The closing prices of six stocks from Nifty500 dropped over 1.5% relative to the VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price) on September 24, and a shift below the VWAP suggests a potential bearish trend, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.When the closing price falls below the VWAP, it signifies that the closing price is lower than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day, with the average being weighted by trading volume. This can be seen as a potential indication of increased selling pressure.

items.title: Premier Energies, JSW Holdings among 6 stocks showing Bullish RSI upswing
items.description: Six stocks from the Nifty500 pack that gained over 1% on September 24 were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from StockEdge.com. It is an uptrend signal if the RSI value has crossed above 50 from below. "RSI trending up" means that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are increasing, suggesting strengthening momentum in the price of the stock. This can indicate potential upward movement and may be used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Negative Breakout: These 10 stocks close cross below their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty200 pack, 10 stocks' close prices crossed below their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on September 24, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. Trading below the 200 DMA is a negative signal because it indicates that the stock's price is below its long-term trend line. The 200 DMA is used as a key indicator by traders to determine a particular stock's overall trend. Take a look:

items.title: US equities end lower as valuation concerns creep in
items.description: U.S. stocks closed lower on Wednesday as investors took profits amid concerns about high valuations flagged by Fed Chair Powell. The market awaits key inflation data, while sectors showed mixed performance, with materials declining and energy rising. Company news included a surge for Lithium Americas and a drop for Micron Technology, influencing overall market sentiment.

items.title: Asian stocks in tight range as global rally stalls
items.description: Asian stocks showed mixed performance following Wall Street's losses, as an AI-driven rally showed signs of fatigue. Investors are closely watching policy risks, including US investigations into imports and concerns over visa issues affecting Korean investments. Attention is now shifting to upcoming economic data and potential impacts on market direction as October approaches.

items.title: JSW plans Rs 7,000 crore NCDs for AkzoNobel buy
items.description: JSW Group plans to raise funds for acquiring AkzoNobel India. The group will issue non-convertible debentures to raise ₹7,000 crore. JTPM Metal Traders will handle the issuance. The bonds have a tenure of four years and seven months. They offer an IRR of 8.5%. The NCDs are backed by corporate guarantees from JSW Group entities.

items.title: Quest Global may sell up to 6% holding to raise over $200 million
items.description: Quest Global, the engineering services outsourcing firm, is planning a pre-IPO funding round aiming for a valuation between $3 billion and $3.5 billion. The company intends to sell a 5-6% stake, seeking $200-$225 million from a new investor, involving both primary and secondary share sales.

items.title: Quadria Capital weighs Encube sale, keeps public float option alive, too
items.description: Quadria Capital is exploring options to sell its stake in Encube Ethicals. The healthcare investor considers both a controlling stake sale and an IPO. Encube Ethicals, a dermatology firm, is valued at $2.2 billion. KKR, Blackstone, and EQT show interest in acquiring a stake. JP Morgan is already mandated for the sale.

items.title: Ganesh Infraworld plans Rs 200–250 crore share sale
items.description: Ganesh Infraworld, an EPC firm based in Kolkata, intends to raise funds. The company plans to secure Rs 200-250 crore through a qualified institutional placement soon. Ganesh Infraworld got listed on NSE SME Emerge platform last year. Since its debut, the company's stock has increased significantly. However, the company's shares experienced a slight dip recently.

items.title: IPO Watch: Gurunanak Agriculture, Matrix Geo among 5 SME issues in focus. Who’s leading the GMP race?
items.description: In the IPO-heavy week, SME IPOs have been drawing varied investor interest. Investors should track these five public issues on NSE: Gurunanak Agriculture India, Matrix Geo Solutions, Ecoline Exim, Prime Cable Industries, and Manas Polymers and Energies. Their respective grey market premiums (GMPs) provide an early glimpse of potential listing trends.

items.title: Investing: Buying correct business & ignoring volatility in Nifty. 6 large-caps from different sectors with upside potential of up to 35%
items.description: Here’s an interesting way to categorise Indian equity investors: Those who entered the market before Covid, and those who did so post-Covid. Now, a large majority of today’s investors would fall in the post-Covid category. Why is this worth mentioning at this juncture? Because it is perhaps for the first time that these investors are witnessing an extended correction – the market has been falling for close to a year now. Our message for these investors: Corrections or phases where stock prices fall are inevitable in the market. And may happen for global or domestic reasons. So, focus on investing in a “correct business” because it creates wealth even after weathering all storms. The question is: What is a correct business?

items.title: SBI could receive $466 million in passive inflows if FII limit is raised
items.description: State Bank of India could attract up to $466 million in passive inflows if the foreign investment limit for public-sector banks is raised from 20% to 26%, Nuvama Institutional Equities said. The move would allow higher MSCI index weightings. The government is reportedly considering the change as part of reforms to boost capital while retaining at least 51% public ownership in PSBs.

items.title: Hindustan Copper shares rally over 6% on surge in global copper prices
items.description: Hindustan Copper shares surged sharply after global copper prices spiked due to a production halt at Grasberg, the world’s second-largest copper mine in Indonesia. The mine suspension, caused by a fatal mudflow, tightened global supply and pushed copper futures to 15-month highs.

items.title: Sebi hasn’t started consultation process to remove weekly expiry, says Nithin Kamath
items.description: Sebi has intensified scrutiny of the options market following surveys highlighting significant retail losses. The regulator floated the idea of extending derivative contract tenures last month and recently introduced measures such as delta-based open interest calculation. These changes could impact major market participants, potentially moderating trading volumes and reducing volatility, while Kamath acknowledged possible restrictions on weekly options or stricter suitability norms.

items.title: Nine colours of Navratri, nine shades of financial wisdom
items.description: Axis Mutual Fund connects Navratri's nine colours with financial wisdom, urging investors to embrace qualities like peace, courage, and stability. It emphasizes building a secure financial foundation through diversified investments and disciplined budgeting. The article highlights the importance of early action, aligning ambition with prudence, and goal-based investing to secure loved ones' futures.

items.title: Adani Power shares bounce back, rise 6% after 2-day selloff. What triggered the surge?
items.description: Adani Power shares rose sharply on Thursday after a two-day, 21% decline triggered by profit booking post-stock split and rally. Investor sentiment improved following Sebi’s regulatory clearance, a shareholder letter from Gautam Adani, and strong group financials, highlighting robust growth and key operational milestones.

items.title: Dixon Technologies shares rise as UBS upgrades it to buy rating, sees 27% upside
items.description: Dixon Technologies shares: UBS upgraded the stock to a ‘Buy’ with a ₹23,000 target, implying ~27% upside. UBS highlighted Dixon’s expansion into non-semiconductor smartphone components, expecting EBITDA margins to rise 110 bps by FY28, outperforming consensus estimates.

items.title: Citi re-initiates coverage on SBI with ‘buy’ rating, sets Rs 1,050 target price
items.description: Citi has re-initiated coverage on State Bank of India (SBI) with a ‘Buy’ rating and a target price of Rs 1,050, citing strong credit growth, improved returns, and operational efficiencies. The brokerage expects FY26–FY27 loan growth of 13–14%, NIMs of 2.8–2.9%, and ROE of 14–15%. Risks include asset slippages, lower NIMs, and higher credit costs.

items.title: China Moves to Strengthen Yuan Bonds in Hong Kong
items.description: China’s central bank will roll out a series of measures to support the development of Chinese yuan bonds in Hong Kong. The move aims to strengthen the offshore bond market and attract more investors. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Economists See RBI Keeping Interest Rate Steady at 5.50% Through 2025
items.description: The Reserve Bank of India is expected to keep its key interest rate at 5.50% on October 1 and for the rest of the year. The central bank is taking a cautious approach to gauge the impact of its past rate cuts on the economy. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: India’s Rs 70,000 crore push for maritime dominance echoes on D-Street. Are shipbuilders next multibaggers?
items.description: India's ambitious Rs 70,000 crore maritime push, including infrastructure status for large ships, aims to revolutionize shipbuilding. This initiative targets a significant increase in global market share, potentially generating 30 lakh jobs and attracting substantial investment.

items.title: Japan’s Monetary Policy: Timing, Risks and Inflation Trends
items.description: At the July meeting, the BOJ decided unanimously to keep borrowing costs steady. However, some members expressed support for resuming interest rate hikes in the future. Opinions on inflation were mixed: while some members felt it was still below the 2% target, others observed that inflation expectations were approaching or had already reached the target. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Sensex falls over 50 pts, Nifty below 25,050 as D-St extends losing streak to day 5
items.description: Indian equities traded flat on Thursday, recovering from early losses amid gains in consumption-focused stocks fueled by festive season expectations. Foreign outflows and U.S. visa restrictions created caution in the market. While broader markets showed positive movement, auto stocks declined due to concerns about Jaguar Land Rover's cyberattack impact.

items.title: Chasing carmaker stocks? Here's the hidden $80 billion auto play that's quietly minting fortunes
items.description: While car sales surge during Navratri due to GST cuts, the auto components industry emerges as a hidden investment gem. Companies supplying parts to major automakers are experiencing significant stock growth, outpacing the OEMs themselves. Factors like premiumization, EV transition, and government policies are fueling this growth, projecting the auto component market to reach $200 billion by 2030.

items.title: Ashish Kacholia-backed smallcap stock soars 17% as board to mull bonus issue, stock split on Sept 27. Do you own?
items.description: Fineotex Chemical shares surged 16.6% after the company announced a board meeting on September 27 to consider dividend declaration, stock split, and bonus shares. The agenda also includes raising authorised capital. Investor focus sharpened as ace investor Ashish Kacholia holds a 2.74% stake, amplifying market interest in corporate developments.

items.title: NSE’s unlisted shares tumble 17% from May peak. Are late entrants paying the price?
items.description: NSE’s unlisted shares have fallen 17% from their May peak amid Sebi scrutiny of weekly options and IPO speculation. The drop mirrors pressure on BSE and MCX, even as NSE prepares for its long-awaited listing and retains dominance in India’s equity market.
